data.title: Best in the Area
data.text: This is hands down the best Chinese Restaurant in the tri-state area. It has been there for years. Eating in is better.

data.title: The Best!!
data.text: Excellent chinese food! Authentic, made the way it should be. This is not fast food, or buffet quality food, it is so much better. They have the very best egg rolls and fried rice in Evansville! I love this place. The cashew shrimp is to die for!

data.title: Excellent Asian Food!
data.text:
This is the first place that I ever ate Chinese and it was 34 years ago..  I was concerned about finding something that I would like, but soon realized this was a restaurant that I would return to have some great food for many years to come.  

The Chicken Chow Mein is the best I have ever had anywhere!  It is my go to choice.  I have tried many other dishes and have never had a meal that failed to please.

The service is usually very good and timely.  The only improvement that I offer is for them to change out table linens more often.  I don't think the dining area is as clean as it should be.  I have been in the kitchen several times and I have no complaints at all about the cleanliness of the kitchen.

I would encourage you to give this restaurant a visit.

data.title: Average take out
data.text: Meh,,,,work group tried carry out for the first time last week. it was a collective "meh.."  From the whole group. Disappointing, as it is near work, and we do carry out weekly as a group. We all found it strange that soup AND egg roll comes with lunch @ dine-in, but not with carry out? I had the gung-bo chicken, was average, not anything to write home about. 4 co-workers had different dishes and had the same reaction, "just ok".The enroll had potential, but was soggy from laying in the juices of the main dish. Perhaps they should bag this separate. Unfortunately, our search for decent Chinese takeout near work will continue

data.title: My favorite sit down Chinese restaurant in Evansville.
data.text: I have been coming to Shing-Lee's for well over 25 years now.  Our parents used to bring us as children so we grew up with the place.  The Hawaiian Wedding is my favorite dish and I think they have THE best egg drop soup in town.  The restaurant is located on the main street walkway and evening hours are spotty.  I would suggest a quick call ahead to make sure they are open after 5 pm.  If you are looking to try a new family owned Chineese place in Evansville for sure put this one on your short list.

data.title: About as close to Lucky Dragon as you'll get
data.text: If you didn't already know, the owner of Shing-Lee is the brother of the owner of the former Lucky Dragon restaurant, so their recipes are similar. The place is a little dingy, and it's not a super friendly place. The food is pretty good though. It would be a better place in a better location.

data.title: Really Old and Cool
data.text: This place is a downtown institution.  It is very busy at weekday lunch and empty, but open, in the evening.  It a source of Evansville's Cantonese dining history, which is oddly extensive.  If you just tell them the sort of thing you like, you can have an absolutely unbelievable genuine Cantonese dinner here.  It is my favorite Cantonese.
